Summary Excellent software engineering skills, passion for robust system design and strong quantitative capacity. High interest in automated trading systems. 
 
In the past year, I worked on distinct Research and Engineering projects at a leading quantitative hedge fund. In my engineering work, I created a FIX module to allow for risk checking of all orders right before they are sent to the exchange, including automated testing (C++, boost, FIX). For my research project, I created a software library to systematically analyze trading strategies (python pandas, trend-following).  
 
During my PhD studies, I investigated software and hardware techniques for making large datacenters (like Google's) more energy efficient. My solutions involved distributed algorithms, linear optimization and resource management at the operating system level. 
 
 
Tech skills: 
---------------- 
Highlevel programming: C, C++ (expert), boost 
Analytics: Python Pandas (very good) 
Financial: FIX protocol, Quickfix library (good) 
Scripting: Python (very good), KDB/q (basic), Perl, Shell, Awk 
Working with large codebases, debugging complex software 
Parallel and distributed programming: pthreads, MPI 
Build tools: git, svn, Make, Scons  
Operating systems: Linux, Windows 
Familiarity of the X86 architecture and the Linux kernel 
Low-level programming: X86 Assembly 
 
Analytical skills: 
----------------------- 
Algorithm design 
Distributed Algorithms 
Systematic analysis

Summary I am a passionate but pragmatic Engineering leader who maintains a strong customer focus and I recognize that at the end of the day, technology only succeeds when it meets the customer’s needs.  
 
I work to empower my team to focus on solving problems that have the biggest impact to our customer and the goals of the business. I have embraced XP principles since I first read Extreme Programming Explained and have continued to use them throughout my career, in addition to Scrum and Kanban processes, in an Agile development environment. 
 
My primary focus is on building efficient, scalable enterprise products and services. At GoDaddy, I work to build reliable, scalable hosting solutions that enable Small Business owners to establish their presence in the digital economy and thrive.

Summary Versatile Software Quality Engineer skilled in validating complex software systems. Expertise in writing and automating comprehensive test plans for secure financial applications, web-based applications and mobile application at both the user interface level and API level.. Builds, mentors, and trains Quality Engineering teams that deliver projects against aggressive schedules in an Agile development environment. Known as an excellent troubleshooter of technical issues communicating and consulting with internal and external clients. Reputation for coming up-to-speed quickly, frequently requested to join teams tackling new issues or features. Worked for tech pioneers such as Intel and Netscape. 
 
Other interests and experience includes aircraft avionics, prototype electronic fabrication, fabrication for Motorsports applications, and general mechanical aptitude. Class 15-89 Who's Who in American Junior Colleges 2001 Each year, a select group of students is called forward to accept one of the most prestigious awards the academic community can bestow — selection to Who’s Who Among Students. This exclusive honor is conferred by more than 2,842 schools in all 50 states and the District of Columbia and is symbolized by the presentation of an award certificate. 
 
Through our years of serving higher education, Who’s Who Among Students has become one of the most highly regarded and long-standing honors programs in the nation, having earned the overwhelming respect of college faculties and administrations. And for the students – the outstanding campus leaders of the year – national recognition by the Who’s Who program marks a pinnacle of scholastic achievement.
